title: Three-leaf pesto for city kitchens
excerpt: Basil, mint, and arugula blended into a bright, zero-waste pesto.
author: Nila Karim
content:
Toast sunflower seeds and blend with basil, mint, and arugula.

Add roasted garlic, lemon zest, and olive oil. Finish with salt and pepper.

Serve with whole-grain pasta or sourdough.

title: Weeknight microgreen noodles
excerpt: A quick bowl with sesame dressing and rooftop greens.
author: Jonas Liu
content:
Whisk tahini, soy, ginger, and lime for a creamy dressing.

Toss with chilled noodles and finish with microgreens.

Top with toasted peanuts and scallions.

title: Citrus salad for sunny balconies
excerpt: Segmented oranges, baby greens, and herb vinaigrette.
author: Lea Morgan
content:
Combine citrus segments with tender greens.

Shake a vinaigrette of olive oil, honey, and chopped herbs.

Dress just before serving for max crunch.

title: Balcony composting without the mess
excerpt: Layer greens and browns to keep odors low and soil rich.
author: Sasha Lee
content:
Use a sealed bin with a carbon-rich base layer.

Add dry leaves or shredded paper with each food scrap layer.

Stir weekly to keep air flowing.

title: Water-wise drip setup
excerpt: Simple drip lines that keep roots hydrated in summer heat.
author: Rae Patel
content:
Use a gravity-fed reservoir with inline drippers.

Water early in the morning to reduce evaporation.

Add mulch to keep roots cool.

title: Shade cloth for rooftop beds
excerpt: Protect delicate greens during peak afternoon sun.
author: Carlos Mendes
content:
Use 40-50% shade cloth to reduce heat stress.

Anchor cloth above beds to keep airflow moving.

Check tension after windy days.

title: Inside a neighborhood greenhouse
excerpt: Tour a co-op space that grows produce for 12 city blocks.
author: Mara Singh
content:
The co-op greenhouse shares tools, seedlings, and harvest schedules.

Members rotate watering shifts and share a weekly distribution table.

The model cuts food miles and builds local resilience.

title: How CSA shares build community
excerpt: Subscriptions that fund growers and shorten supply lines.
author: Nina Osei
content:
CSA shares provide predictable income for growers.

Subscribers receive updates, recipes, and farm visits.

The result is stronger neighborhood food ties.

title: Zero-mile produce report
excerpt: Tracking the impact of local growing on city emissions.
author: Emil Duarte
content:
Urban Harvest reduced average food miles by 42% in 2025.

Shorter routes mean fresher food and fewer transport emissions.

New targets focus on expanding bike delivery routes.
